Text:
kabalizo 4eva indeed!

papakeno, his voice is so soothing, and the synth a killer, ain't that right?
papakeno, looks like you and kabalizo are the only people who liked this mix lol

No, 80z, they are not the only ones lol. I've had a chance to hear the compilation only today. It's as good as your other compilations. I liked Love and Money - Jocelyn Square (1988) the most. I've just found on Wiki that a remaster edition of the album Strange Kind of Love (1988) was issued less than 2 months ago. 
Continue with your fabulous uploads. We'll never abandon you xD

Very awesome, heard 47 a few days ago, loved it and now I'm out for the other 46 volumes.

Thanks
smurphyzeke, I am glad you liked them. By the way I am seeding these babies for anyone interested. My usual seeding time is 11:00 PM to 7AM PST.

Hey...Got a question for you...I'm looking for a song, don't know the group but in it's lyrics there's a line with "Flying the friendly skies" and the songs about a guy and a girl going on an ocean or island vacation. It's from 1987-1989... I'm not sure. Do you know this song, and if so what's the groups name. PLEASE let me know if you know :-)

Hey 80zforever...You have proven yourself to be one of the most, if not the most, generous uploaders in the new wave/alt.80s/synth genre...and I THANK YOU for that. These last few mixes have been first-rate just like the earlier ones. The Rupert Hine single, Hubert Kah, Gary Myrick, Harry, etc etc it's all so damn good. (!!) cheers, man.

Trailblades, give us a little bit more clue man! You are dealing with an old man with dementia here hahahaha.

z-nith happy you liked it.

hey 80z, happen to have 'paper heroes'?
thanks!

I wish I could!!! All I can remember was it was a man and woman duet, and she was singing background vocals. I saw a video of the same song on MTV that same year, but that's all I can remember... P.S. Yeah... I'm getting a little old myself... That's probibly why I can't remember! :-)
arl0011, do you mean the song Paper Heroes by Krew? if that's the one then it's on vol. 28.  As far as I know there was no band by the name of Paper Heroes??
Hey ... Got one more question for ya... Do you know who "Originally" did the song "Birds Of Prey"...My wife says that every copy I got is wrong...especially the beginning...
